subject: Sleep
title: The Anxiety-Insomnia Loop
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Anxiety-Insomnia Loop.

hook.text: You can't sleep because you're anxious. Now you're anxious because you can't sleep. The loop has you trapped.

buildup.text: Anxiety activates the amygdala and raises cortisol, keeping the brain in a hypervigilant state at bedtime.

discovery.text: This hyperarousal prevents the brain from transitioning into the relaxed state needed to initiate sleep.

twist.text: One bad night creates anticipatory anxiety about the next, which itself prevents sleep. The loop self-reinforces.

climax.text: Breaking the loop requires targeting the anxiety, not the sleep directly. Calm the mind and sleep follows.

punchline.text: Insomnia feeds anxiety. Anxiety feeds insomnia. Break one to break both.

quiz.question: What maintains the anxiety-insomnia loop?
options: Anticipatory anxiety about sleep creates more sleeplessness
